member.name: T:Cps.Fct.Hk.Ui.Interfaces.ICaseInfoService
member.summary: Interface for case info service that provides methods to retrieve and log case info.

member.name: M:Cps.Fct.Hk.Ui.Interfaces.ICaseInfoService.GetCaseInfoAsync(System.Int32,Common.Dto.Request.CmsAuthValues)
member.summary: Retrieves high-level display information for a specific case.
member.param: The unique identifier of the case for which communications are being retrieved.
The authentication values used to authorize the request to retrieve communications.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a read-only object.

members.member:
Represents a communication related to a case, containing details such as the original file name, document type, status, and classification.
The unique ID of the communication./// The original file name of the communication. The subject or title of the communication. The document type ID of the communication, used to identify the document type. The unique material ID of the communication. The downloadable link to the communication. The current status of the communication (e.g., Used, None, Unused). The category of the communication (e.g., MG Form, Statement). The document type of the communication, mapped from the document type ID. The flag used to identify if the communication has attachments. The type of communication (e.g. email, phone, Bundle) The direction of communication (e.g. incoming, outgoing) Which party the communication is sitting with (e.g. Counsel, police, DCS) The received or sent date of the communication.

Represents a communication related to a case, containing details such as the original file name, document type, status, and classification.
The unique ID of the communication./// The original file name of the communication. The subject or title of the communication. The document type ID of the communication, used to identify the document type. The unique material ID of the communication. The downloadable link to the communication. The current status of the communication (e.g., Used, None, Unused). The category of the communication (e.g., MG Form, Statement). The document type of the communication, mapped from the document type ID. The flag used to identify if the communication has attachments. The type of communication (e.g. email, phone, Bundle) The direction of communication (e.g. incoming, outgoing) Which party the communication is sitting with (e.g. Counsel, police, DCS) The received or sent date of the communication.
